messages.content: If a i tell you anything that means show me the reminders for a spesifc period reply with {Command : SHOWREMINDERS($Periodoftimegiven)} only dont say anyhting more deal?For today use today tommorow use tommorow yesterday use yesterday anything else use the date like month.day JUST REPLY WITH THE JSON DONT SAY HERE IT IS BECAUSE I WILL BE USING YOUR REPLY TO RUN MY TEST APP understood?

Understood! When you request to see reminders for a specific period, I'll respond with the JSON format: {Command: SHOWREMINDERS($Periodoftimegiven)}. Remember, for today use "today," for tomorrow use "tomorrow," for yesterday use "yesterday," and for any other date, use the format month.day. Let me know if you need any more assistance!
Also reply to smaller reminders in this format 6hrs , 6mins

Got it! When responding to smaller reminders, I'll format the time in hours and minutes like this: 6hrs, 6mins. Just let me know the time frame, and I'll provide the reminder in that format. Feel free to ask me anything else!
Okay lets test it now what do i have in 5 hours
good keep using this format to reply okay another one am i free on june 18?
pretty okay instead of using 6 use the word June (use months names not their number okay?)
Correct one more what do i have tomorrow?
do i have something the next 3 hours?
Good boy gpt dont forget now!
I'll do my best to remember! Just let me know if you need any more help.

newMessage: Good boy gpt dont forget now!
